body.p: Because there are multiple types of nociceptors (Table C) that can transmit information at different rates (Table D), our pain sensation is not always the same. Scientists generally recognize three different pain categories (sensations or stimulus modalities), as described in Table E.

tr.td: Sharp, stinging pain that is well localized. Arises mainly from the skin.

Elicited by inflammation secondary to damaged tissue (hit thumb with hammer, etc.). Arises mainly from skin, but also from tissues such as muscle. It is more diffuse and longer in duration than fast pain.
Poorly localized pain arising from deep structures (joints and viscera).
